qas.question: When did secondary education emerge in the United States?
Why was secondary school introduced in the U.S?

answers.text: rise of large corporations and advancing technology

qas.question: Why wasn't secondary school introduced in the U.S?
Who didn't benefit from secondary schools?
Why were high schools not created?

context: <b3_0>Secondary education<b3_0/> in the United States did not emerge until <a0_0>1910<a0_0/>, with the <a1_0><b4_0>rise of large corporations<b4_0/> and advancing technology<a1_0/> in factories, which required skilled workers. In order to <b6_0>meet this new job demand<b6_0/>, high schools were created, with a curriculum focused on practical job skills that would better prepare students for white collar or skilled blue collar work. This proved beneficial for both <a2_0><b5_0>employers and employees<b5_0/><a2_0/>, since the improved human capital lowered costs for the employer, while skilled employees received a higher wages.
